Entry.JapaneseText: [VARIABLE]
Entry.EnglishText: [VARIABLE]

Entry.JapaneseText: 宿屋のおかみ
Entry.EnglishText: Inn Hostess

Entry.JapaneseText: <Claire>
Entry.EnglishText: <Claire>

Entry.JapaneseText: select
Entry.EnglishText: Select

Entry.JapaneseText: 食材屋「雪割草」
Entry.EnglishText: Grocer

Entry.JapaneseText: notice
Entry.EnglishText: Notice

Entry.JapaneseText: 宿屋「白銀亭」
Entry.EnglishText: InnKeeper

Entry.JapaneseText: 宿屋・食材屋
Entry.EnglishText: Inn - Grocery Store

Entry.JapaneseText: スールズ
Entry.EnglishText: Sulz

Entry.JapaneseText: スールズ・宿屋・食材屋
Entry.EnglishText: Sulz - Inn - Grocery Store

Entry.JapaneseText: <Veigue>……あまりウチに 来ないでほしいねぇ……
Entry.EnglishText: ...I don't really want you coming by here, <Veigue>...

Entry.JapaneseText: ウチの子にも近寄らないでおくれ。
Entry.EnglishText: Don't go anywhere near my child either.

Entry.JapaneseText: <Veigue>の知り合いかい？
Entry.EnglishText: You know <Veigue>?

Entry.JapaneseText: ふーん…… どんなもんなのかねえ……
Entry.EnglishText: Hmmm... I'm not sure what to think of that...

Entry.JapaneseText: <Veigue>、あんた必ず クレアを助けておいでよ！
Entry.EnglishText: You need to save <Claire>, <Veigue>!

Entry.JapaneseText: 大変な事になっちまったよ……
Entry.EnglishText: How awful...

Entry.JapaneseText: あの子は村一番の器量よしで、 この村の誇りだったんだ。 それを、なんでまた……
Entry.EnglishText: She was the most beautiful girl in the village, the pride and joy of Sulz... Gone once more...

Entry.JapaneseText: うちの旦那？
Entry.EnglishText: My husband?

Entry.JapaneseText: なんか集会所に行くとか なんとかって…… 言ってたけど……
Entry.EnglishText: He said something about going to the Meeting House...

Entry.JapaneseText: ちょっとあんた、また、 何かやらかしたんじゃ ないでしょうね？
Entry.EnglishText: Hey, you didn't do anything troublesome again, hm?

Entry.JapaneseText: なんか村の中が ぎくしゃくしちゃってさ……
Entry.EnglishText: Then why is it that the village is so tense...

Entry.JapaneseText: あんたがクレアを氷に 閉じ込めた時みたいになるのは もうゴメンだよ。
Entry.EnglishText: I don't want this village to go back to how it was when you had <Claire> trapped in ice.

Entry.JapaneseText: ほら、あんたは知らないかも しれないけど、あんたをかばう人と モメたんだよ。
Entry.EnglishText: You might not know this, or maybe you do, but I took issue with the folks who sheltered you.

Entry.JapaneseText: 村の中でごたごたするのは たくさんだね。
Entry.EnglishText: There's a lot of trouble in town.

Entry.JapaneseText: うちの旦那、ポプラおばさんに すっかり感化されちゃってさ。
Entry.EnglishText: My husband was inspired by what Ms. Poplar said.

Entry.JapaneseText: まあ、私もわからなくは ないけどさ……
Entry.EnglishText: Me, well, I'm still unsure...

Entry.JapaneseText: ちょっと、あんた…… クレアを助け出してから……
Entry.EnglishText: Hold on... Since you saved <Claire>...

Entry.JapaneseText: がんばってるみたい じゃないの……？
Entry.EnglishText: You're doing your best, right?

Entry.JapaneseText: ヒューマが、何かと つっかかってくるから ムキになったりしてたけど……
Entry.EnglishText: Those Huma keep driving me up the wall with their incessant arguing...

Entry.JapaneseText: くだらない張り合いよね……
Entry.EnglishText: It's not worth the hassle...

Entry.JapaneseText: うーん……ポプラおばさんの パイは食べたいけど…… あんたたちヒューマも、 来るんでしょう……？
Entry.EnglishText: Hmmm...I'd love to have some of Ms. Poplar's pies... But are you Huma going to be there as well...?

Entry.JapaneseText: はい……気まずいでしょうが、 直接会って話せば、お互いの気持ちが わかるんじゃないでしょうか？
Entry.EnglishText: Yes... It might be awkward after all that's happened, but would we not be able to come to an understanding if we talk face to face?

Entry.JapaneseText: ……そうねぇ…… どうしようかしら。
Entry.EnglishText: I see... Let me consider it.

Entry.JapaneseText: ……みんなでパイをねぇ…… ……そうねぇ…… どうしようかしら。
Entry.EnglishText: Everyone is going to have pie... I see... Should I go as well?

Entry.JapaneseText: また<Blue>ラドラスの落日<White>みたいな事が 起こったりしない……わよね。
Entry.EnglishText: At least this isn't another <Blue>Dusk of Ladras<White>...I hope.

Entry.JapaneseText: 元気かい？
Entry.EnglishText: Are you well?

Entry.JapaneseText: ウチでゆっくりしてくかい？
Entry.EnglishText: Are you going to rest here?

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0><scale:140>休憩しますか？ はい いいえ
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0><scale:140>Would you like to rest? Yes No

Entry.JapaneseText: いいところに来た。 お前たちにいい事を 教えてやろう。
Entry.EnglishText:
You've come at the right time.
I've got some good advice I'd like to share with you.

Entry.JapaneseText: 旅の途中で疲れた時は ちゃんと食事をしなされ。
Entry.EnglishText: When you are worn out on your travels, make sure to have a proper meal.

Entry.JapaneseText: <Green>戦闘終了後のＨＰ回復には <Red>料理<Green>が役に立ちます。
Entry.EnglishText: <Red>Cooking<Green> is useful for recovering HP after battle.

Entry.JapaneseText: <Green>次の戦闘に役立つ効果を発揮し、 戦闘不能の回復もできるので 料理を活用しましょう。
Entry.EnglishText: <Green>Cooking can also provide useful effects for the next battle and revive fallen allies.

Entry.JapaneseText: <Green>料理の実行は一戦闘ごとにできます。 オート設定にしておけば、 毎回料理メニューを開く必要はなくなります。
Entry.EnglishText: <Green>You can cook one meal per battle. If you set Auto Cooking to on, you won't need to access the cooking menu after every battle.

Entry.JapaneseText: <White>料理の大切さがわかったか？
Entry.EnglishText: <White>See how useful cooking is?

Entry.JapaneseText: これをやるから、 実際にやってみるといい。
Entry.EnglishText: You can have these. Try giving it a shot.

Entry.JapaneseText: クレアが戻って来て、 よかったの、<Veigue>。
Entry.EnglishText: It's wonderful that Claire is back, <Veigue>.

Entry.JapaneseText: 早く家に戻ってやらなくて 良いのかの？
Entry.EnglishText: Shouldn't you be hurrying on home?

Entry.JapaneseText: <Veigue>んとこの お客さんかの？
Entry.EnglishText: Are you with <Veigue>?

Entry.JapaneseText: 何もない村じゃが、 ゆっくり見ていっておくれ。
Entry.EnglishText: There's not much here, so take your time and look at everything.

Entry.JapaneseText: よう来たの。
Entry.EnglishText: Welcome.

Entry.JapaneseText: 買い物も していくかね。
Entry.EnglishText: Come by and buy something too.

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0><scale:140> 食材を買う 世間話をする やめる
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0><scale:140>Buy Food Talk Cancel

Entry.JapaneseText: 食い物は大切にな。
Entry.EnglishText: Food is important.

Entry.JapaneseText: 大地の恵みに感謝するんだぞ。
Entry.EnglishText: Be thankful for the fruits of the Earth.

Entry.JapaneseText: 食事は旅の大事な活力じゃ。
Entry.EnglishText: You need food to stay vigorous on your journey.

Entry.JapaneseText: 大地の恵みに感謝するんだぞ。
Entry.EnglishText: Be thankful for the fruits of the Earth.

Entry.JapaneseText: 村の中が騒がしいが、 それよりも……
Entry.EnglishText: There's a ruckus going on in town... But...

Entry.JapaneseText: 大地の恵みに感謝するんだぞ。
Entry.EnglishText: Be thankful for the fruits of the Earth.

Entry.JapaneseText: ガジュマだ、ヒューマの違いなど、 前からあったというのに……
Entry.EnglishText: Even before, there were differences between Huma and Gajuma...

Entry.JapaneseText: ケンカの理由になるような 話ではあるまいて……
Entry.EnglishText: But those aren't good reasons to start quarrelling...

Entry.JapaneseText: ピーチパイのお。 桃はやはり山の恵みじゃな。
Entry.EnglishText: Peach pie... Peaches truly are the blessings of the mountains...

Entry.JapaneseText: 大地の恵みに感謝するんだぞ。
Entry.EnglishText: Be thankful for the fruits of the Earth.

Entry.JapaneseText: 大地は時として、 災害ももたらすが 怒ってはならん。
Entry.EnglishText: The earth sometimes brings disasters, but do not get angry with Mother Earth.

Entry.JapaneseText: 大地の恵みに感謝するんだぞ。
Entry.EnglishText: Be thankful for the fruits of the Earth.

Entry.JapaneseText: 大地の恵みに感謝するんだぞ。
Entry.EnglishText: Be thankful for the fruits of the Earth.

Entry.JapaneseText: 大地の恵みに感謝するんだぞ。
Entry.EnglishText: Be thankful for the fruits of the Earth.

Entry.JapaneseText: うちに<Veigue>は 泊めちゃならないって 言われてんだよ。
Entry.EnglishText: I've been told not to let you stay here, <Veigue>.

Entry.JapaneseText: 自分の家に帰ったらどうだ？
Entry.EnglishText: How about going to your own house?

Entry.JapaneseText: <Veigue>の友達？
Entry.EnglishText: You're <Veigue>'s friend?

Entry.JapaneseText: だったら、<Veigue>の家に 泊めてもらったらどうだい？
Entry.EnglishText: If that's the case, why don't you stay the night over at his house?

Entry.JapaneseText: 大変な事になった……
Entry.EnglishText: How awful...

Entry.JapaneseText: <Veigue>と関わると ロクな事がないんだ…… まったく……
Entry.EnglishText: Associating with that <Veigue> will only lead you into trouble...

Entry.JapaneseText: ここだけの話、あんまり<Veigue>と 関わらない方がいいよ。
Entry.EnglishText: Just between you and me, you shouldn't get too close to <Veigue>.

Entry.JapaneseText: ポプラおばさんが言ってくれて、 すっとしたよ。
Entry.EnglishText: I was relieved when I heard what Ms. Poplar said.

Entry.JapaneseText: 実は俺も前に似たような事を 考えた事があったんでね。
Entry.EnglishText: In fact, I'd been thinking the same thing before as well.

Entry.JapaneseText: ヒューマは 泊まらせない事にしたんだ。 悪いが、帰ってくれ。
Entry.EnglishText: Huma can't stay here. If that bothers you then you can leave.

Entry.JapaneseText: はあ……なんだか みんな元気ないし……
Entry.EnglishText: Ugh... Everyone's in a bad mood these days...

Entry.JapaneseText: ヒューマとかガジュマとか イチイチ考えるのも、 面倒になって来たな……
Entry.EnglishText: Thinking about "Huma this, Gajuma that" is starting to wear me down...

Entry.JapaneseText: ピーチパイ……
Entry.EnglishText: Peach pie...

Entry.JapaneseText: 他のガジュマたちが来るなら…… 行っても、いいかな？
Entry.EnglishText: If the other Gajuma are going... Perhaps I should go as well?

Entry.JapaneseText: こ、これから何が起きるんだ……？ 夜もおちおち寝てられないな……
Entry.EnglishText: W-what's going on...? I can't get rest even at night...

Entry.JapaneseText: 夜眠れなきゃ宿屋商売も 上がったりだ……！
Entry.EnglishText: If no one's sleeping then my business is going to go under...!

Entry.JapaneseText: がんばってるらしいね、<Veigue> 泊まっていくかい？
Entry.EnglishText: You've got this, <Veigue>. Are you going to rest?

Entry.JapaneseText: 泊まっていくかい？
Entry.EnglishText: Are you going to rest?

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0>『壁の絵』 二十年以上前、強引にここに 泊めさせられ、何枚もの絵を 描かされた旅の画家が、住人の 目を盗んで描いた花の絵。 花言葉「翼をください」
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0>- Wall Painting - Twenty years ago, a travelling artist who was forced to stay and create many paintings drew this piece of a flower that catches the viewer's eye. In the language of flowers, it means "Please Give me Wings."

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0>『駄馬』 二十年以上前、村を訪れた画家を 無理やり泊め、描かせたもの。 その画家がなぜこの絵を描いたかは 不明だが、何か強い意志のような ものを感じる迫力ある作品。
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0>- Pack Animal - Over twenty years ago, an artist who was forced to stay in the village drew this piece. The artist made this piece for reasons unknown, but it's a powerful piece that radiates a resolute feeling.

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0>『スールズ遠景』 二十年以上前、村を訪れた画家を 無理やり泊め、描かせたもの。 スールズ近くの山から見下ろした 光景を描いたもの。 かなりぞんざいに描かれている。
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0>- A Distant Look at Sulz - Over twenty years ago, an artist who was forced to stay in the village drew this piece. It's a view looking down from the mountains around Sulz. It was painted rather sloppily.
